explanation: Agent A has identified a valid, realistic MISRA 21.17 concern: the memset call uses sizeof(OS_impl_timebase_table) which is only the correct byte count when OS_impl_timebase_table is an actual array object. If OS_impl_timebase_table is instead a pointer or an incomplete/extern type, sizeof yields the size of the pointer (typically 4 or 8) and the memset will not necessarily match the actual allocated buffer size and may therefore access beyond the object bounds. Thus the code as shown is potentially non-compliant. Whether a violation actually exists depends on the declaration/definition of OS_impl_timebase_table. If it is defined as a static/automatic array sized to OS_MAX_TIMEBASES (or otherwise known at compile time so sizeof yields the true buffer size), the call is safe and compliant. If it is a pointer/extern/incomplete type (or the size used does not reflect the real allocation), the call can violate Rule 21.17. Recommended fixes: use an expression that unambiguously computes the actual object size (for example OS_MAX_TIMEBASES * sizeof OS_impl_timebase_table[0] when the element count is the authoritative size), or ensure the object is defined as an array so sizeof yields the full buffer size.
